December 2, 1839 |sessionend1 = July 21, 1840 |sessionnumber2 = 2nd
|sessionstart2 = December 7, 1840 |sessionend2 = March 3, 1841 |previous = 25th
|next = 27th }} The 'Twenty-sixth United States Congress' was a meeting of the
legislative branch of the United States federal government, consisting of the
United States Senate and the United States House of Representatives. It met in
Washington, D.C. from March 4, 1839 to March 4, 1841, during the third and
fourth years of Martin Van Buren's presidency. The apportionment of seats in the
House of Representatives was based on the Fifth Census of the United States in
1830. Both chambers had a Democratic majority.
